paper_metadata.title: Different social protection programs are designed in low-income countries to eradicate poverty and improve the food security of poor people

program_information.region: Dire Dawa, Harar, and Jigjiga cities
program_information.target_population: Urban poor living below the poverty line

component_a_cash_support.cash_amount: ETB 60 per person per day (equal to US$2.91 per person per day)
component_a_cash_support.cash_evidence_citation: Conditional cash transfers are the initial subcomponent of safety net support, and they account for around 84 percent of all project recipients. | As a result, the initiative begins with a daily transfer amount of Ethiopian birr (ETB) 60 per person per day (equal to US$2.91 per person per day). | Unconditional payments will benefit people who are unable to work for a variety of reasons

study_characteristics.outcomes_evidence_citation: This study aims to evaluate the impact of participation in UPSNP on well-being | we found a consistently positive impact across models, indicating that participation in UPSNP reduces poverty and increases food security of households
study_characteristics.study_design: Propensity Score Matching (PSM) and Endogenous Switching Regression (ESR)
study_characteristics.design_evidence_citation: This study employed both propensity score matching (PSM) and endogenous switching regression (ESR) models to assess the impact of the UPSNP

evidence_citations.program_name_citation: Currently, the Urban Productive Safety Net Program (UPSNP) is designed to support those who are living in poverty and face food insecurity
evidence_citations.country_citation: household survey data gathered from three main cities of Ethiopia: Dire Dawa, Harar, and Jigjiga in 2022
evidence_citations.target_population_citation: the strategy intends to eliminate poverty and vulnerability among urban poor living below the poverty line
